question: What was the meaning of the basic education advocated by Gandhiji?
option2: Social relevance of education to society
option3: Demand of separate institutions for minorities
option4: Compulsory military training for every student
answer: Social relevance of education to society
explanation: The Wardha scheme of Education, popularly known as \'Basic education\' occupies a unique place in the field of elementary education in India. This scheme was the first attempt to develop an indigenous scheme of education in British India by Mahatma Gandhi, the father of our nation. According to Gandhi, education is the realization of the best in man - body, soul and spirit. He maintained that education must be based on ethics and morality. Ethics and morality are integral to Gandhi\'s life. All his thoughts, actions and speeches are based on these two concepts.
